job description:
Research Scientist

04-Sep-2018

02-Jan-2019

Responsibilities

Are you interested in providing the voice of the payer and patient to a growing portfolio of assets for autoimmune diseases?

As a scientist in Lilly’s Global Patient Outcomes and Real World Evidence (GPORWE) team, you will provide scientific expertise and effective project oversight to ensure the successful fulfillment of the health outcomes research strategy to deliver better patient outcomes that are valued by payers and providers. Projects may focus on disease and/or treatments that Lilly is developing and span the entire lifecycle of clinical development and drug commercialization. You will develop and ensure that appropriate health outcomes research strategies are in place to support Pricing, Reimbursement and Access activities for Lilly products. Responsibilities include the conduct, quality, and integrity of health outcomes studies. From these, you will ensure scientific disclosures, resulting from this research, demonstrate and apply in-depth knowledge, understanding, and evaluation of clinical, economic, and/or patient reported outcomes methodologies.

An important role for the Research Scientist in the Immunology Development phase is to support data generation for Value Based Agreements (VBAs). The scientist will develop foundational approaches related to real world evidence (RWE) needs and capabilities, which support product registration and commercialization and provide voice of the payer for VBA.

A crucial part of this role is effective communication of health outcomes findings and concepts to internal and external business partners. Leadership in the dissemination to the scientific community is expected. In addition, your scientific leadership and effective collaboration in cross-functional initiatives, including collaborating with therapeutic area medical and commercial teams, RWE Strategic Scientists, FDAMA Scientists, and Outcomes Liaisons is key.
